original_title: Sri Lanka gets 1.48 million tourists in 2023 led by India, Russia
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT- Sri Lanka has welcomed 210,552 tourists in December taking the total for the year to 1,487,303, according to Chairman of the Sri Lanka Tourist Development Authority Priyantha Fernando.
The top market was India, with 43,973 visitors followed by the Russian Federation with 29,657 visitors.
In December the top five tourist markets were India, Russia, United Kingdom, Germany and Australia.
The full year 2023 number is a little short of an original 1.5 million target for 2023.
Sri Lanka is targeting 2.3 million tourists in 2024, Fernando told EconomyNext in November 2023.
